comments.body: For some reason the `inline` argument checks changed behaviour. Before, when it tried the extension method `stripMargin` above it failed when the argument was not a constant and then found the `augmentString` conversion. Now it types it as the the extension method with an `inline` String but does then does not fail due to the non constantness of the argument. This is also the source of the issue in `scalatest`.
The new resolution `stripMargin` seems better, but the `inline` parameter should have failed.
This is only the case for the prefix in an extension method.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +6,10 @@
  private def stripImpl(x: String)(given qctx: QuoteContext): Expr[String] =
    Expr(augmentString(x).stripMargin)

  inline def typeChecks(inline x: String): Boolean =
